page.title: 04ST.PHILIP & ST.JAMES CHURCH.
page.content: { The parish church of St.Philip & {St.James, Tow Law, was completed in {1868}though the spire was added later. The church costs, (Â£1892 8s 3d), were met by the parishioners. { The unusual choir screen (made up of {hundreds of pine cones, acorns and {conkers stuck on a wooden framework) {is unique in England. It was made by {Rev. Espin and helpers in the 1890's. The carved wooden choir surround was built as a war memorial. The font, at the back of the church, also has a carved wooden cover. The basin is made of lead. The lectern is made of solid brass in the shape of a winged eagle. Hanging on the walls are the some of the paintings that Rev. Espin brought back from his travels. The stained glass windows date from 1882 to 1984.
